page.title: 03Dairy Farming ...Marchwood
page.content: {There are several dairy farms}in the area.Dairy farming is the main form of agriculture.In one typical farm, the dairy herd consists of 120 cows which are mostly Friesians.This breed gives the most milk.Calves are reared on the farm....normally about 25 each year.The cows are usually milked for about 305 days each year, and are given 60 days rest before their next calf.The cows are fed in the winter on silage made from grass grown on the farm the previous summer.Up to 5000 bales of hay are also made.The cows graze over about an acre a day in the summer.They are milked twice a day..at 5.30am and 3.30pm.The milk is collected in a bulk tanker and sent to the Unigate Dairies in Southampton.
